title: Store & Colleague Login
text: The Store Login uses your portal Username & Password. The Colleague Login uses Clerk id and Password, you will need to select which store from the dropdown. You will then see a splash screen. NOTE: This can be branded you will need to speak with your sales contact. NOTE: You can navigate away from sections without loosing progress. Tap the menu button located in the top left this will expand to show your menu options. For further options tap the Here you can change various settings or change the location of shop. Settings Here you can choose the following settings Stock Camera Item Sync Stock Here you set the time between scans per second. Camera From here you can choose which camera to use and set the amount of time between scans. Item Sync Force Full Sync - This will sync all items, for example, if you are doing inventory changes this will push those changes to Imagine. Remove Saved Items - This will delete any local data, for example, if you are working offline and you remove saved items they will be permanently deleted. Change Shop This will display all the shops linked to your tenant tap on the shop to change the location. Logout This will log you out of the Companion app and return you to Login Page.
description:
The Store Login uses your portal Username & Password.



The Colleague Login uses Clerk id and Password, you will need to select which store from the dropdown.



You will then see a splash screen.

NOTE: This can be branded you will need to speak with your sales contact.



NOTE: You can navigate away from sections without loosing progress.

Tap the menu button located in the top left this will expand to show your menu options.



 For further options tap the Here you can change various settings or change the location of shop.


 



Settings

Here you can choose the following settings 

  • Stock
  • Camera
  • Item Sync


Stock

Here you set the time between scans per second.



Camera 

From here you can choose which camera to use and set the amount of time between scans. 



Item Sync

Force Full Sync - This will sync all items, for example, if you are doing inventory changes this will push those changes to Imagine.

Remove Saved Items - This will delete any local data, for example, if you are working offline and you remove saved items they will be permanently deleted.



Change Shop

This will display all the shops linked to your tenant tap on the shop to change the location.


Logout

This will log you out of the Companion app and return you to Login Page.

title: Item Information
text: Item Information allows you to scan or search items and retrieve information and properties. Tap for search This allows you to search based on the following attributes. Item Barcode Item Description Press Tap for Search and input either the code/description of the item and press the icon to begin. The search results will then display in a list. Tapping on one of the items in the list will bring up its information. It will display the item information and image if one has been added. Drop-down menus. General Information - This displays the item barcode or item No. Description - If a description has been given for the item it will be displayed here. Nearby Stock - This shows what stock is on hand nearby you can use the slider to increase or decrease the distance. Scan item barcode Tap the camera icon, a small frame will be displayed to scan the item barcode. Scanning the barcode will bring the same information page as if you were to use search.
description:
Item Information allows you to scan or search items and retrieve information and properties.



Tap for search 

This allows you to search based on the following attributes.

  • Item Barcode
  • Item Description

Press Tap for Search and input either the code/description of the item and press the  icon to begin.

The search results will then display in a list.



Tapping on one of the items in the list will bring up its information. 

It will display the item information and image if one has been added. 


Drop-down menus.

General Information - This displays the item barcode or item No.

Description - If a description has been given for the item it will be displayed here. 

Nearby Stock -  This shows what stock is on hand nearby you can use the slider to increase or decrease the distance.



Scan item barcode

Tap the camera icon, a small frame will be displayed to scan the item barcode.

Scanning the barcode will bring the same information page as if you were to use search.

title: Stocktake
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Ad-Hoc Scheduled Ad-Hoc This is for when you need to do an unscheduled stock check. NOTE: If you leave the Stocktake section your items will be saved and will be restored when you return to scanning. When performing an Ad Hoc count, you will be asked to start scanning or searching for the goods to be counted. Firstly, you will need to select the location from the drop-down menu and tap continue. When a line is scanned/selected it will be added to the count and will display the quantity on hand. If necessary, you can alter the quantity by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press Continue to add to the stock check. NOTE: You can review previous counts and edit quantities if an error is made. Scans are timestamped and grouped by a configurable parameter. So, when you scan items with the same barcode they will be consolidated. When a count has been completed (if you have the correct permissions) it can be reviewed and submitted to Imagine, however, quantities are not adjusted at this stage. You will need to use Imagine to commit the count. To remove an item from the stock take list, swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning the items, use the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm the submission of the stock count. You will get a confirmation of the stock take submission and the number of lines within the stock take. Scheduled This is used for stock takes that need to be performed on particular dates. NOTE: If you leave the Stocktake section through the device controls such as a gesture or O/S button then your items will be saved and will be restored when you return to scanning. If you leave the Stocktake via the Companion App ‘Back’ button then you will asked if you would like to preserve the stock count or not. When you select a Scheduled Stocktake you will be shown a list of stocktakes that are either Open or Counting. Note: Calculating, Calculated, Closed, Committing or Creating stocktakes are not shown on the Companion App. Once a stocktake is chosen you will be asked to enter a Count Name. A default Count Name based on the current date and time is given. You should enter a Count Name in line with your stocktake procedures. If you click Cancel you will be returned to the list of stocktakes as a Count Name is required to continue into the counting screen. You will then be shown a list of expected items to be scanned on the Stock take. If you scan an item that is not expected in the stock take you will hear an audible beep and a notification will display. Once the correct item is scanned it will be added to the list. NOTE: you can edit the Count Name here using the ‘pencil’ edit icon If necessary, you can alter the quantity by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press Continue to accept the updated item count. NOTE: You can review previous counts and edit quantities if an error is made. Scans are timestamped and grouped together, meaning when you scan items with the same barcode they will be consolidated in to a single line and the Count will be updated as necessary. When a count has been completed (if you have the correct permissions) it can be reviewed and submitted to Imagine, however, quantities are not adjusted at this stage. You will need to commit using Imagine. To remove an item from the Stocktake list, swipe the line to the left and press bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning the items, use the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be prompted to either Add to existing counts, Replace existing counts, or Cancel. Add: counts will be added to any existing counts in Imagine to give you a stocktake Quantity. The Quantity tells you the total stock of that item in your shop Replace: counts will remove matching items from any current counts and this count will be the single value that makes up your stock Quantity in your shop Cancel: will return you to the list of stocktakes, preserving the current count You will get a confirmation of the stocktake submission.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Ad-Hoc
  • Scheduled


Ad-Hoc

This is for when you need to do an unscheduled stock check.


NOTE: If you leave the Stocktake section your items will be saved and will be restored when you return to scanning. 

When performing an Ad Hoc count, you will be asked to start scanning or searching for the goods to be counted.

Firstly, you will need to select the location from the drop-down menu and tap continue.



When a line is scanned/selected it will be added to the count and will display the quantity on hand. 



If necessary, you can alter the quantity by pressing the line you wish to alter.

You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. 

Press Continue to add to the stock check. 



NOTE: You can review previous counts and edit quantities if an error is made.

Scans are timestamped and grouped by a configurable parameter. So, when you scan items with the same barcode they will be consolidated.

When a count has been completed (if you have the correct permissions) it can be reviewed and submitted to Imagine, however, quantities are not adjusted at this stage. You will need to use Imagine to commit the count. 

To remove an item from the stock take list, swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove.



When you have finished scanning the items, use the top right-hand corner to finish. 

You will be asked to confirm the submission of the stock count. 



You will get a confirmation of the stock take submission and the number of lines within the stock take.



Scheduled

This is used for stock takes that need to be performed on particular dates.


NOTE: If you leave the Stocktake section through the device controls such as a gesture or O/S button then your items will be saved and will be restored when you return to scanning. If you leave the Stocktake via the Companion App ‘Back’ button then you will asked if you would like to preserve the stock count or not.


When you select a Scheduled Stocktake you will be shown a list of stocktakes that are either Open or Counting. Note: Calculating, Calculated, Closed, Committing or Creating stocktakes are not shown on the Companion App. 


Once a stocktake is chosen you will be asked to enter a Count Name. A default Count Name based on the current date and time is given. You should enter a Count Name in line with your stocktake procedures. If you click Cancel you will be returned to the list of stocktakes as a Count Name is required to continue into the counting screen.


You will then be shown a list of expected items to be scanned on the Stock take. 


If you scan an item that is not expected in the stock take you will hear an audible beep and a notification will display.


Once the correct item is scanned it will be added to the list.

NOTE: you can edit the Count Name here using the ‘pencil’ edit icon


If necessary, you can alter the quantity by pressing the line you wish to alter.

You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. 

Press Continue to accept the updated item count. 


NOTE: You can review previous counts and edit quantities if an error is made.

Scans are timestamped and grouped together, meaning when you scan items with the same barcode they will be consolidated in to a single line and the Count will be updated as necessary.


When a count has been completed (if you have the correct permissions) it can be reviewed and submitted to Imagine, however, quantities are not adjusted at this stage. You will need to commit using Imagine. 

To remove an item from the Stocktake list, swipe the line to the left and press bin icon to remove.



When you have finished scanning the items, use the top right-hand corner to finish.

You will be prompted to either Add to existing counts, Replace existing counts, or Cancel.

  • Add: counts will be added to any existing counts in Imagine to give you a stocktake Quantity. The Quantity tells you the total stock of that item in your shop
  • Replace: counts will remove matching items from any current counts and this count will be the single value that makes up your stock Quantity in your shop
  • Cancel: will return you to the list of stocktakes, preserving the current count 



You will get a confirmation of the stocktake submission.

title: Replenishment
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Gap Scan Pick List NOTE: Gap Scan and Pick List are only used within the Companion App. There is no equivalent module in Retail Suite Portal. Gap Scan This is for when you have gaps on the shelves so items that are out of stock this will generate a replenishment list. When you start a Gap Scan you will need to select the location. As you scan the gaps they will be put into a list. If you incorrectly scan a line you can remove it by swiping the line to the left and tapping the bin icon to delete. When you have finished scanning the items use the checkmark in the top right hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm submission of the stock count. You will than be asked to start again or go to pick list. NOTE: If you choose to Go to Pick List you will be shown the pick list you have just created. Pick List This is a list generated when a gap scan has been completed. Once you have completed a Gap Scan a Pick list is then used to find the missing lines. The information on screen will show who created the pick list the time it was created and the number of lines. Select which pick list you require you will then see the list of items (previously added via Gap Scan) you need for replenishment. Once the item is found, you can use the check box to confirm its available for replenishment. When you have finished picking the items use the checkmark in the top right hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm submission of the stock count. NOTE: If you try to finish the pick without marking the check boxes you will be presented with the below warning. Once you have pressed Confirm you will be given a notification that the Pick list was successfully submitted. The pick list will now be removed from the list.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Gap Scan
  • Pick List


NOTE: Gap Scan and Pick List are only used within the Companion App. There is no equivalent module in Retail Suite Portal.



Gap Scan

This is for when you have gaps on the shelves so items that are out of stock this will generate a replenishment list.

When you start a Gap Scan you will need to select the location.



As you scan the gaps they will be put into a list. 



If you incorrectly scan a line you can remove it by swiping the line to the left and tapping the bin icon to delete. 



When you have finished scanning the items use the checkmark in the top right hand corner to finish.

You will be asked to confirm submission of the stock count. 



You will than be asked to start again or go to pick list. 

NOTE: If you choose to Go to Pick List you will be shown the pick list you have just created. 



Pick List

This is a list generated when a gap scan has been completed.

Once you have completed a Gap Scan a Pick list is then used to find the missing lines. 

The information on screen will show who created the pick list the time it was created and the number of lines.



Select which pick list you require you will then see the list of items (previously added via Gap Scan) you need for replenishment.



Once the item is found, you can use the check box to confirm its available for replenishment.

When you have finished picking the items use the checkmark in the top right hand corner to finish. 

You will be asked to confirm submission of the stock count.



NOTE: If you try to finish the pick without marking the check boxes you will be presented with the below warning.


Once you have pressed Confirm you will be given a notification that the Pick list was successfully submitted. The pick list will now be removed from the list.

title: Store Information
text: The Store Information shows you various financial data across days, weeks and months. NOTE: This section is purely for reviewing financial data however this information is also available via various sources in the Retail Suite Portal. There is no direct comparison for layout or UI of the Companion App in the Retail Suite Portal.
description:
The Store Information shows you various financial data across days, weeks and months.

NOTE: This section is purely for reviewing financial data however this information is also available via various sources in the Retail Suite Portal. There is no direct comparison for layout or UI of the Companion App in the Retail Suite Portal.

title: Transfer
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Create List Create This is for when you need to send items to another store. When creating a new transfer you will be asked to choose which destination you are transferring to along with a description. NOTE: If a Shop or Vendor has been Blocked for Transfer these will not appear in the list. Begin scanning or use the search to add the transfer lines. NOTE: If you try to ship items which will send them into a negative quantity, a prompt will appear confirming the order line that has been over-scanned. The line can be altered and then recommitted. You can alter the quantity if necessary by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press continue to add to the stock check. To remove an item from the Transfer list swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning/adding the items use the checkmark icon in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm the submission of the Transfer. You will be sent to a confirmation screen from here you can start again or check the transfers by going to List. List This shows the Transfers that have been created. Here you will see a list of created transfers, along with the date the transfer was made. You can review the transfer by clicking on the required transfer. This section is purely for reviewing Transfers. 8 This is the total quantity transferred. 3 This is the total number of lines transferred.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Create
  • List

Create 

This is for when you need to send items to another store.


When creating a new transfer you will be asked to choose which destination you are transferring to along with a description.

NOTE: If a Shop or Vendor has been Blocked for Transfer these will not appear in the list. 



Begin scanning or use the search to add the transfer lines.

NOTE: If you try to ship items which will send them into a negative quantity, a prompt will appear confirming the order line that has been over-scanned. The line can be altered and then recommitted.



You can alter the quantity if necessary by pressing the line you wish to alter.

You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. 

Press continue to add to the stock check.



To remove an item from the Transfer list swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove.

When you have finished scanning/adding the items use the checkmark icon  in the top right-hand corner to finish. 

You will be asked to confirm the submission of the Transfer.



You will be sent to a confirmation screen from here you can start again or check the transfers by going to List.



List

This shows the Transfers that have been created.


Here you will see a list of created transfers, along with the date the transfer was made. 

You can review the transfer by clicking on the required transfer.



This section is purely for reviewing Transfers.  

8 This is the total quantity transferred.

3 This is the total number of lines transferred.

title: Receiving
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Transfer In Purchase Orders Auto Receive Transfers In Auto Receive Purchase Orders Click & Collect Transfer In This is for when a transfer is being accepted by the receiving shop/store. You will see a list of transfers that have been created select the one required. Scan the items within the transfer list and they will move to a Scanned Items List below. It will show how many were sent and how many you have received. If necessary, you can alter the quantity by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press Continue to add to the Transfer amount. To remove an item once it's been scanned/added swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning/adding the items use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm the submission of the Transfer. You will be sent to a confirmation screen. Purchase Orders Used when a PO has been delivered and being accepted into the shop/store. When a Purchase Order has been created via the Inventory Module within Imagine, those orders will show here. The list will show which items are expected when you receive the PO. Locate and scan the items on the list this will then be moved to Scanned Items. You can alter the quantity if necessary by pressing the line you wish to alter. You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. Press continue to add to the Transfer amount. To remove an item once it's been scanned/added swipe the line to the left and tap the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning/adding the items use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to approve receiving. If you confirm you will see the below message. The PO will now be removed from the list. Auto Receive Transfers In This is when a transfer can be received automatically this is a faster way to accept transfers. This is where you can easily receive a Transfer from other stores without having to scan individual items in, You will need to search or scan the transfer details. Once the transfer is located it will show various details on the screen. NOTE: If you tap Show Lines this will list the items that should be in the Transfer, this helps when checking if there are any items missing or if quantities are different. Once you have checked the items on the list and confirmed use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to approve receiving. You will receive the below notification the PO has now been received. Auto Receive Purchase Orders When a Purchase Order has been created via the Inventory Module within Imagine, this is where you receive those POs You can scan or search for the reference number that was given to the PO at creation. NOTE: If you press the Show Lines this will list the items that should be in the PO, this helps when checking if there are any items missing or if quantities are different. Once you have checked the items on the list and confirmed use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to approve receiving. You will receive the below notification the PO has now been received. Click & Collect Click & Collect in Receiving is for when a customer has placed an online order to be picked up from a store/shop and the parcel is scanned in upon receiving. Once the customer order arrives you can scan or search for the order number. NOTE: You can add multiple orders at the same time. Once you have located and scanned the order(s) use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm receiving of the order(s). Confirm - This will finish the Receiving process. Cancel - This will take you back to the scanning page. If you confirm the receiving of the order(s) you will see Submission Successful. NOTE: Click & Collect orders that are scanned into the store/shop will show in inventory until a customer picks up the order.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Transfer In
  • Purchase Orders
  • Auto Receive Transfers In
  • Auto Receive Purchase Orders
  • Click & Collect


Transfer In

This is for when a transfer is being accepted by the receiving shop/store.

You will see a list of transfers that have been created select the one required.



Scan the items within the transfer list and they will move to a Scanned Items List below. 

It will show how many were sent and how many you have received.



If necessary, you can alter the quantity by pressing the line you wish to alter.

You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. 

Press Continue to add to the Transfer amount.


 


To remove an item once it's been scanned/added swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove.

When you have finished scanning/adding the items use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish.

You will be asked to confirm the submission of the Transfer.



You will be sent to a confirmation screen.



Purchase Orders

Used when a PO has been delivered and being accepted into the shop/store.

When a Purchase Order has been created via the Inventory Module within Imagine, those orders will show here. 



The list will show which items are expected when you receive the PO.



Locate and scan the items on the list this will then be moved to Scanned Items.



You can alter the quantity if necessary by pressing the line you wish to alter.

You can use the - or + buttons or use the Numpad to input the new quantity. 

Press continue to add to the Transfer amount.



To remove an item once it's been scanned/added swipe the line to the left and tap the bin icon to remove.

When you have finished scanning/adding the items use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish.

You will be asked to approve receiving. 



If you confirm you will see the below message. The PO will now be removed from the list.



Auto Receive Transfers In

This is when a transfer can be received automatically this is a faster way to accept transfers. 

This is where you can easily receive a Transfer from other stores without having to scan individual items in,



You will need to search or scan the transfer details.



Once the transfer is located it will show various details on the screen.

NOTE: If you tap Show Lines this will list the items that should be in the Transfer, this helps when checking if there are any items missing or if quantities are different.



Once you have checked the items on the list and confirmed use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish.

You will be asked to approve receiving.



You will receive the below notification the PO has now been received.



Auto Receive Purchase Orders

When a Purchase Order has been created via the Inventory Module within Imagine, this is where you receive those POs



You can scan or search for the reference number that was given to the PO at creation.

NOTE: If you press the Show Lines this will list the items that should be in the PO, this helps when checking if there are any items missing or if quantities are different.


Once you have checked the items on the list and confirmed use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish.

You will be asked to approve receiving. 



You will receive the below notification the PO has now been received.



Click & Collect

Click & Collect in Receiving is for when a customer has placed an online order to be picked up from a store/shop and the parcel is scanned in upon receiving.

Once the customer order arrives you can scan or search for the order number.

NOTE: You can add multiple orders at the same time.



Once you have located and scanned the order(s) use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish.

You will be asked to confirm receiving of the order(s).

Confirm - This will finish the Receiving process.

Cancel - This will take you back to the scanning page. 



If you confirm the receiving of the order(s) you will see Submission Successful.

NOTE: Click & Collect orders that are scanned into the store/shop will show in inventory until a customer picks up the order.

title: Click & Collect
text: Click & Collect is used when a customer comes to pick up their web order(s). The customer should have an order number (this is scanned when the order is received by the store/shop) Once the order has been located you will see information regarding the order these can be used to confirm the customer's identity. Once you have seen the customer's ID you can tick the Validation box. NOTE: The checkmark will only appear once the Validation box has been ticked. When you click the checkmark you will be asked to confirm. Confirm - This will finish the Click & Collect process. Cancel - This will take you back to the Click & Collect page. If you confirm the Click & Collect has been received, you will see a notification of Submission Successful NOTE: Click & Collect orders will now be removed from inventory.
description:
Click & Collect is used when a customer comes to pick up their web order(s).

The customer should have an order number (this is scanned when the order is received by the store/shop)



Once the order has been located you will see information regarding the order these can be used to confirm the customer's identity.

Once you have seen the customer's ID you can tick the Validation box. 



NOTE: The checkmark will only appear once the Validation box has been ticked.

When you click the checkmark you will be asked to confirm. 



Confirm - This will finish the Click & Collect process. 

Cancel  - This will take you back to the Click & Collect page.


If you confirm the Click & Collect has been received, you will see a notification of Submission Successful

NOTE: Click & Collect orders will now be removed from inventory.

title: Adjustments
text: Adjustments are made when you have identified an item in-store which has an incorrect stock level and requires adjustment. You can either Scan or search for an item. To alter quantities tap the line you wish to alter and use the - or + buttons or the numpad to input the new quantity. Tap continue to make the adjustment. Adjustment Reason Additional Found - If you have found more stock than expected or showing On Hand. Unable to Locate - If you make an adjustment that is -0 and there is no stock on hand in-store but its showing in inventory. To remove an item from the adjustment list, swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning the items use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm submission of the Adjustments. Once confirmed you will see the below notification.
description:
Adjustments are made when you have identified an item in-store which has an incorrect stock level and requires adjustment.



You can either Scan or search for an item.

To alter quantities tap the line you wish to alter and use the - or + buttons or the numpad to input the new quantity. 

Tap continue to make the adjustment.


Adjustment Reason

  • Additional Found - If you have found more stock than expected or showing On Hand. 
  • Unable to Locate - If you make an adjustment that is -0 and there is no stock on hand in-store but its showing in inventory. 



To remove an item from the adjustment list, swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove.

When you have finished scanning the items use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish.

You will be asked to confirm submission of the Adjustments.



Once confirmed you will see the below notification.

title: Return To Vendor
text: Return To Vendor is used when an item needs to be sent back from the store to the Vendor (supplier) of the item. Select the Vendor you are sending the item back to and use a Reference, this could be a number or description. Scan or search for the item(s) to be sent back to add these to the return. You can either scan or search for an item. To alter quantities tap the line you wish to alter and use the - or + buttons or the Numpad to input the new quantity. Tap continue. To remove an item from the stocktake list swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove. When you have finished scanning the items, use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish. You will be asked to confirm the submission of the Returns. Cancel - You will be returned to the scanning page. Confirm - You will then see a Submission Successful message appear from here, and you can begin a new submission.
description:
Return To Vendor is used when an item needs to be sent back from the store to the Vendor (supplier) of the item. 



Select the Vendor you are sending the item back to and use a Reference, this could be a number or description. 



Scan or search for the item(s) to be sent back to add these to the return. 



You can either scan or search for an item.

To alter quantities tap the line you wish to alter and use the - or + buttons or the Numpad to input the new quantity. 

Tap continue.



To remove an item from the stocktake list swipe the line to the left and press the bin icon to remove.

When you have finished scanning the items, use the checkmark in the top right-hand corner to finish.

You will be asked to confirm the submission of the Returns.



Cancel - You will be returned to the scanning page.

Confirm - You will then see a Submission Successful message appear from here, and you can begin a new submission.
